info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 4:34PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Southeastern Collier, Western Miami-Dade and Southwest Broward Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 432 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking developing strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Big Cypress National Preserve to 12 miles northeast of Dade-Collier Training Airport to Tamiami. Movement was south southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Doral, Sweetwater, Dade-Collier Training Airport, Country Walk, Kendale Lakes, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, Miccosukee Resort, Tamiami, The Hammocks, University Park, The Crossings, Richmond West, Fountainbleau, Olympia Heights, Big Cypress National Preserve, Kendall West, Tamiami Fairgrounds, Fiu South Campus and Westwood Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
